column4: Amalgamations of frigid energy, willing and eager to turn you into an icicle.
Totems seem to appear in response to conflict. You appear to be evidence of this.
Frozen totems are more powerful than their chilling variants, being able to freeze any would-be assailants solid.
Every bit as powerful and hungry as its reputation.
Many a ship has sunk in these waters. Well-preserved in ice, they have waited for your arrival.
Ghosts are especially malleable when it comes to magical energy, moulded into specific elements by their surroundings.
Demons with an affinity to Ice can learn its magic just as well as any other.
Somehow, even after centuries entombed in frost, their bowstrings work just as well.
Crackling with power, just waiting for a victim to draw near.
Absorbing enough dark and lightning energy can empower a ghost into a creature of legend.
Metal plates and rods embedded into solid stone, held together by crackling arcs of electricity.
It's "a slight annoyance" until it delivers a deadly shock straight into your chest.
Don't be fooled by the ritual garb and mysticism. This is very real magic.
A twisting, formless blob of arcane power, given a strange kind of intelligence through its immense complexity.
Wands may, over time, become saturated with magic and gain a form of intelligence. They generally do not appreciate their prior treatment.
A walking mushroom, having absorbed enough magical energy to cast its own spells.
Magishrooms can grow big. Very big.
Demons able to resist their primal urges long enough can develop a more humanlike grasp on magic. For this reason, they are quite rare.
Like all things, wands may be chosen as vessels for ghostly presences.
Magic is just as much a force of nature as fire or lightning - its manifestations also just as potent.
For reasons unknown, ghosts are drawn to unworn sets of armour. Some suggest it may be because of their similarity to human forms.
The ghost of a ghost can still die, after all!
Often the byproducts of dark rituals, revenants form when latent echoes of dark magic meld with the vengeful death throes of human sacrifices.
Some spirits are more driven than most, not content to simply drift with the tides of undeath.
It is said that when the time comes again for one who has cheated death, the horsemen ensure they do not escape a second time.
A devoted knight serving a long-dead liege, still as stalwart in their mission as the day they pledged fealty.
Angel magic is based on fealty. These angels devote themselves to the fiery wrath of the heavens.
Angel magic is based on devotion. These angels channel bolts of cleansing lightning from the heavens to the mortal plane.
Angel magic is based on purity. These angels consecrate the ground with bursts of holy energy.
High angels command armies of lesser angels, blessed with greater power.
High angels command great armies of lesser angels, blessed with greater power.
Commanding armies of high angels and overwhelming power alike, these warleaders are sent to combat only in the direst of circumstances.
With their final breath, Archangels will willingly let themselves be consumed by the power that sustains them, giving their lives such that their enemy may be defeated.
Agents of the faith. Not quite mortal, but nowhere near angel.
False or not, the people's hopes have given it power.
Sometimes, a priest can become so enamoured with their sermons that they begin to ardently believe them. Soon they find their power stemming not from heaven but instead from within.
Trusted agents of the faith. Probably on first-name terms with at least one angel.
Mastery over life and death isn't so difficult, really. The hard part is staying on the right side of that line afterwards.
Typical footsoldier of a necromancer. Usually just as fragile as their masters.
A terrifying amalgam of flesh, bone and magical energy. Clearly a failed experiment of a dark wizard, but the magic coursing through it still grants it immense strength.
column13:
Sweep; 40 physical dmg; range 1
Life Drain; 32 dark dmg; range 1; heals user by damage dealt

column4: A towering entity comprised of many smaller swarm insects, all moving as one.
The giant enemy spider...
column13: Trample; 500 physical dmg; range 1

column4: Perfectly formed golems raised in service of the Order of Order.
As lowly as they are, these acolytes are just as capable of performing the Incantations of Order.
Titanic constructions of magically hewn stone, raised in service of the Order of Order.
Only to be fabricated by the most orderly of the Order of Order, their construction of pure granite grants them even greater strength.
Created specifically to oppose demons of fire and chaos, the mud titan is a necessary evil for the Order of Order to employ.
With enough devotion, a Wizard of the Order of Order can perform the same golemcraft rituals as lesser adherents using solid metal.
The apex of order. Only a Master of Order could hope to bend steel into such a form.
The last rank in the Order of Order one can achieve by study alone. Well-trained in sorceries and rituals alike.
Wizards of Order are allowed access to the Order of Order's secret texts as thanks for their contributions. With them, they can become even more useful to the Order.
Only a few High Wizards of Order are selected out of the Order of Order every year. They form the Council of Order.
Masters of Order are those in the Order of Order who have achieved the feat of creating a perfect Steel Colossus. The Order of Order bows to their wisdom.
